people.name: Annie Cain
people.description: Annie Jo is a comic book reading, sneaker-collecting librarian and developer who excels at repetitive tasks. Trust us, you haven't met anyone like her.

people.name: Paul Deschner
people.description: Paul is a developer and ShelfLife project lead. He swims, he speaks multiple languages, he likes Finnish literature. Paul has worked at Harvard libraries since 1990.

people.name: Kim Dulin
people.description: Kim (co-dir) is a librarian and a former Legal Services lawyer. She likes cooking, golf and beaches. And dreaming up new ways to share what libraries know.

people.name: Jeff Goldenson
people.description: Jeff loves solving problems with design. Personal keywords include: Libraries, Bucky Fuller, Koolhaas, Wabi-Sabi, The Whole Earth Catalog, New Mexico.

people.name: Matt Phillips
people.description: Matt is a developer in the Lab. He bike races (as in bicycle) when he can. He eats vegetables and enjoys the more technical articles that come up on Hacker News.

people.name: David Weinberger
people.description: David (co-dir) writes about the effect of tech on ideas, has worked at sw startups, and is a researcher at the Berkman Center. He likes his Internets open.
